TopicTitle: Whats is the stupidest thing you've done after you landed on the MÃƒÂ¼n.

Articles.Content:
Just wondering so I can see other stupid, useless, or dumb things, like my 40th mission to the MÃƒÂ¼n in my random rocket science video...

(The reason why I said after you landed on the MÃƒÂ¼n so I know you can play OK.)
When I crash landed in the old demo, and nothing survived but my capsule, I used to roll torque to drive around for a while. Pretty silly.

A rover with two left wheels, the right side broke during a botched landing. It had a set of solar panels so I used alternating WASD to drag myself around for a while, covered about a kilometer before I got bored. I might land a kerbal one day to fix it.
I tipped over a lander and couldn't get it upright again. I tried ramping it off of a hill to see if I could get airborne (vacuum-borne?), but it kind of ended up vaporizing the rocket instead.
this is not on mun but one time on duna i landed flew my lander/plane around for 5 minutes then crashed upon trying to land
My stupidest was probably accidentally running Bob into some downwards-facing stabilization rockets on my mun base. Cue kilometre faceplant up a hill into orbit.

I landed a probe with it's Solar Cells closed, then time-warped to make it day.

Then I realised I can't open the Solar Cells when there's no charge left.

"Doh!"

Jeb EVAed 20ish km to a craft with fuel enough to get to orbit. I did get a bit of help from the wife. Still can't believe she held down the w and shift keys for about an hour for the green little guy. SQUAD sure did give those Kerbals character.

Man that was a long "~walking on the Mun one day~"

My first mun landing, The landing gears were very short, so the engine is longer than the legs, So when I touched down the lander, it was standing on the engines, not the legs. No problems, but it looked very ugly and awkward.

After that I learned to test on kerbin first if everything looks right
Finally landed a rover on the mun. 10 seconds later, rolled it. Exploded. Doh!...

I pressed the abort button by accident and popped off the capsule which flipped off and landed on the docking port which led to another rescue mission. Used a spacecrane on that mission... oooh... haven't remade a spacecrane in ages. Wonder if KAS has been updated yet.
Run away, Bill, run away..

I once set the staging wrong so my disposing of the transfer stage 5,000 meters above the moon resulted in my capsule popping off. The Kerbal were EVA'd in time, but I would have to call my first moon shuttle flight a failure.

Taking off to land again in a spot where Kerbin is visible. "You totally have enough fuel to do that, man!"

Edited June 6, 2013 by Felsmak
finally managing to land on another planet. Presses space and decouples the pod from the main fuel stage...
Landed on MÃƒÂ¼n nicely. Crew member nÃ‚Â°1 of 2 gets out to explore a little. Gets bored and comes back to discover the ladder is too short to get back on board.

Landed on MÃƒÂ¼n nicely. Crew member nÃ‚Â°1 of 2 gets out to explore a little. Gets bored and comes back to discover the ladder is too short to get back on board.

Just use the EVA pack...

First landing of a prototype lander/return vehicle, and I sat it down at the rim of a crater. Right on the rim. Then, oops, butterfingers me, I hit "W" instead of "2" to safe the descent engine and deactivate all RCS. Pitched the vehicle right over into the crater. It rolled down the slope, but came to rest at the bottom with the legs still attached. Then I tried the cycle-the-landing-gear-whilst-flailing-away-with-RCS trick to right the craft. Success! Well, almost success. Through the course of the whole fiasco I managed to smash off all the solar panels. Thus began the planning for my first rescue mission...
Hit "end flight" rather than space centre with 12 preloaded kerbals in....I am disappoint
I wanted to adjust the position of a ship I had in my MÃƒÂ¼n base but ended up sending it careening up a valley at 100+m/s and smashing in to things killing the kerbs.

My stupidest thing (so far) is deciding to travel long distances on Mun with the EVA pack. It works great when moving, but stopping is another matter. I managed to land Bob on his head soft enough not to kill him, but also with enough velocity that he didn't stop sliding for about 600m... up hill. When I tried to use the same method to get back to the ship, I kept overshooting/oversliding the landing site and eventually decided 'screw it, I'm walking!'

Good times. Poor Bob has been having lots of migraines recently though... Must be the space food.

One time I landed on the mun with a three kerbal capsule. I flew one kerbal into the poodle engine and he exploded. After that I sat there for a while wondering why I just killed a kerbal by ramming him into an engine. Then I casually flew back into space and eventually landed on Kerbin.
oh the stupidiest thing I did after landing on the mun was PURCHASE kerbal space program, you see it runs on this resource called "free time" and it's isp SUCKS!
Launched the lander retrograde to the command module.
I remember my first attempt to land on the Mun... KSP was the first time I ever used M/s. So I thought that 30 m/s was a good landing speed, somehow the Pilot managed to survive.
